greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Nonprimes such that n and phi(n) are relatively prime.
comment: Also nonprimes n such that there is only one group of order n, i.e., A000001(n) = 1.
Also numbers n such that n and A051953(n) are relatively prime. - _Labos Elemer_
Apart from the first term, this is a subsequence of A024556. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Apr 15 2015
Every Carmichael number and each of its nonprime divisors is in this sequence. - _Emmanuel Vantieghem_, Apr 20 2015

An alternative definition (excluding the 1): k is strongly prime to n <=> k is prime to n and k does not divide n - 1 (cf. A181830). n is cyclic if n is prime to phi(n). n is strongly cyclic if n is strongly prime to phi(n). The a(n) are the strongly cyclic numbers apart from a(1). - _Peter Luschny_, Nov 14 2018
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: Select[Range[450], !PrimeQ[#] && GCD[#, EulerPhi[#]] == 1&] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Jan 31 2011 *)
program: (PARI) is(n)=!isprime(n) && gcd(eulerphi(n),n)==1 \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Apr 15 2015
def isStrongPrimeTo(n, m): return gcd(n, m) == 1 and not m.divides(n-1)
[1] + [n for n in (1..403) if isStrongCyclic(n)] # _Peter Luschny_, Nov 14 2018
xref: If the primes are included we get A003277. Cf. A000001, A000010 (phi), A181830.
results.author: _Christian G. Bower_, Nov 15 1999
